meanings.definition: To add vowels to (a word or syllable)
meanings.sent1: She will vowelize the word to make it easier to read.
meanings.sent2: It is important to vowelize the syllables correctly in this language.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the students to vowelize the words, but they only added consonants!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to vowelize the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes vowelize the canvas, bringing life to the painting.

meanings.definition: To pronounce with a vowel sound
meanings.sent1: He will vowelize the words clearly so everyone can understand.
meanings.sent2: In English, we vowelize the words by emphasizing the vowel sounds.
meanings.sent3: The parrot tried to vowelize the words, but it kept squawking instead.
meanings.sent4: Her voice seemed to vowelize the air, resonating with pure tones.
meanings.sent5: The music vowelizes the silence, filling the room with harmony.
